data.title: [js] update jsconfig.json to latest tsconfig.json schema
data.body:
Extracted from #2848

The current schema doesn't support "es6"

``` json
            "module": {
              "description": "Specify module code generation: 'CommonJS', 'Amd', 'System', 'UMD', 'es6', or 'es2015'.",
              "enum": [ "commonjs", "amd", "umd", "system", "es6", "es2015" ]
            },
```

data.title: "Add selection to next find match" should select whole word and match the case
data.body:
When I place the cursor before a variable, in my case `c`, and press `cmd+D` for "Adding the selection to next find match",  it should only select the occurrences of that variable. It should be "Whole Word" and "Match the case".
![screen shot 2016-02-10 at 11 24 04 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1800401/12953525/d5a010b6-cfe8-11e5-9bf7-89017d7a72bd.png)

But it selects any occurrences of the selected text in any context, even in a middle of a string: 

![screen shot 2016-02-10 at 11 23 47 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1800401/12953524/d59d831e-cfe8-11e5-949c-f8becae2c7ba.png)

p.s.: Setting the configurations in search tab to match only "Whole word" and "Match case", did not help.

data.title: Go to File does not find files in directory junctions
data.body:
If you have a parent folder with two directory junctions pointing somewhere else, "Go to File" ( or Ctrl+P ) will not be able to find the file you are looking for. However, if you put one of the directory junctions as your workspace folder "Go to File" will be able to find any existing file in the folder with no problem.

My current setup has two folders in two complete different locations and to edit them I have two junctions inside a folder with .git and .vscode. There doesn't seem to be an issue with other editors like Sublime Text 3

data.title: How to get vscode API after updating the dev to ^0.11
data.body:
Hi , 
I have updated the API and set the package.json as
`"devDependencies": {
    "typescript": "^1.6.2",
    "vscode": "^0.11.x"
  },`

But im getting error on extension.ts on 
`import * as vscode from 'vscode';`

cannot find module vscode.

How to access latest API?

data.title: Question: How to support both 0.10.7-insider and 0.10.8 with same package?
data.body: Just released an update of the PowerShell extension and it seems I set my `engine` field in a way that blocks people using the Insider build from using it.  Should I be using `0.10.7-insider` as the engine so that semver allows 0.10.8 also?

data.title: Add the 'Toggle Wordwarp' command to the View menu
How to find a location of word or regex match in a document
IntelliSense stuck on "Loading..." after enabling Salsa on 0.10.8.
data.body:
I use Windows 10.
I have set the environment variable to activate Salsa and I tried either to use a local typescript@next or a global one, but in both cases my JS IntelliSense remains stuck and only displays "Loading..." everywhere.
The Salsa indicator is shown in the statusbar.
I don't know what's wrong on my end since it looks like it's working for everyone else.
![salsa](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3266897/12948861/120079ee-d005-11e5-8a24-460709fbcd13.PNG)
(It's the same for both JS and JSX).

Thanks.

data.title: Salsa not working with require('path') with src folder
data.body:
I can't reopen #2850 but the original problem still stands and I can reproduce it
- Enable Salsa
- create a new npm module project (npm init -y)
- Install node typings
- Create a `src` sub folder and add the basic `src\jsconfig.json`
- Add the following to `src\test.js` - `var p = require('path').`

Intellisense does not work correctly on the `.`

Everything works with the files in the project root.

data.title: Javascript docs say use TSD but it is replaced by typings
data.body:
on https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/javascript

"The typings are easily managed using TSD, the TypeScript Definition manager."

But on https://github.com/Definitelytyped/tsd#readme

"DEPRECATED: TSD is deprecated, please use Typings and see this issue for more information."

data.title: Indenting exports overwrites them and then undo doesn't work
firstLine MUST not trump exension
data.body:
I have a TS file which has a first line like

```
#!/usr/bin/env node
```

which is supported by the tsc compiler.

VSCode now treats the ts file as JS which results in very wired behavior.

In general I think first line is content sniffing (like binary detection) and shouldn't overrule extensions.

data.title: Need to disable extensions not just uninstall them
data.body:
When looking for problems with intellisense (#2850) I wanted to clean up my config by disabling all extensions. However they can only be deleted.

This would be a generally useful option in case extensions are causing problems.
## 

@joaomoreno
- [x] Figure out format to store extensions disablement in settings
- [x] Move extension scanning to Renderer (with @joaomoreno)
- [x] Ignore disabled extensions when scanning for them at runtime
- [x] Provide UI for enabling / disabling an extension for a workspace or globally
- [x] Telemetry

data.title: Wrapping column settings by filetype

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hello,

is there a way to configure wrapping settings by filetype? If not, then this is a feature request. 

Usecase: if I have both code and text files in my project, I would like to wrap text files but not code files.

data.title: Show other invisible characters with renderWhitespace option
data.body:
just in case atom also render CR, EOL characters
[0-31 and 127 ASCII code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ASCII#ASCII_control_code_chart) are non-printable characters
also #2085 is related

data.title: Indexing project files using CTRL+P is ridiculously slow as compared to other IDEs
data.body: I opened a large project with a lot of Java + bash files and CTRL+P takes forever to find and list a file. Same project gets file list indexed almost immediately when I open it in sublime text and CTRL+P file search works smooth as butter. VSCode needs to improve performance of file search.

data.title: Set shortcut key for Open Folder

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Please assign a shortcut key combination for Open Folder of VS Code. Ctrl + Alt + O for example

data.title: Please enable vscode extension in C#
data.body: In addition to javascript. vscode should be able to write extension with C#. And vscode library should available in C# too

data.title: Improve Install experience on Mac
data.body: The thing that is missing for me most during the Mac install experience is moving VS Code.app to the Applications folder. Once it is there it is discoverable by spotlight and won't accidentally be deleted when cleaning out the download folder.

data.title: Fixed typo in json parser
Match longer JavaScript operators first to support ligatures.
data.body:
With the new support in version 0.10.8 for font ligatures, I'd noticed that some operators weren't being combined properly in JavaScript. This is because the language file had some of the shorter operators being matched first, so `||` would match as two `|` operators and `!==` would match as `!=` followed by `=`. Switching the order in the language file has fixed the ligatures in addition to having more correct grouping.

I've made the same fix to the JavaScript, JavaScriptReact, TypeScript, and TypeScriptReact language files.

data.title: Allow extensions to get a LanguageConfiguration for a language
data.body: As far as I can tell, extensions can set a `LanguageConfiguration` object for a language with `languages.setLanguageConfiguration()`, but they can't get an existing one. This would be very useful for getting information about the language of the current document.

data.title: Ligatures only work for some languages
data.body:
I'm not sure if this is an intended feature but certain ligatures seem to turn on/off depending on the selected language for the file.

If that is an intended feature, then there are quite a few languages missing entries on the ligature map. 
I use vscode for Rust and the basic function result `->` is not being translated to an _arrow_. Same thing is true for `>=`, `<=` symbols.

data.title: Using type script definition in new custom language?
data.body:
Hi,
I am trying to use vsc with a proprietary language. 
I managed to handle the syntax coloration easily.
For the completion I generated on my language in type script definition files (.d.ts). With that done, I have exactly what I want but **it only works if I use javascript as my file language** (and not my new own language)

**So my  question is:**
Can I leverage Type Script Definition files for custom languages completion? If so, how would you do that?

Thanks for your help
Nicolas
